dcterms:creator: Y. LeCun
L. Bottou
Y. Bengio
P. Haffner
dcterms:description: MNIST is possibly the most used dataset in machine learning. It consists of 60k handwritten digits from 0 to 9, making up 10 classes. The digits are black and white â€“ one color channel in resolution 28 pixel by 28 pixel. It is widely used to demonstrate how Machine Learning works.
dcterms:title: MNIST

dcterms:creator: Han Xiao
Kashif Rasul
Roland Vollgraf
dcterms:description: Fashion-MNIST is a more difficult dataset that is made in exactly the same format: 60k images with one color channel and resolution 28x28 pixel. It consists of 10 classes of fashion articles, such as shoes, t-shirts, bags, and others.
dcterms:title: Fashion-MNIST

dcterms:creator: A. Krizhevsky
dcterms:description: CIFAR10 dataset contains colored (3 channels, RGB) images with resolution of 32x32 pixels of live and mechanical objects. There are 10 classes in total: 6 animals and 4 inanimate classes. These are actual pictures of 3D objects taken from various perspectives.
dcterms:title: CIFAR10
